description.narrative:
Implementation of the Project is expected to generate robust local demand for the labor-intensive textile industry, create ~850 direct and indirect jobs with up to 20% for women and enhance tax collection by encouraging formalization of retail and upstream activities. The Project has the potential to provide more job opportunities for female workers, both for those who work directly with the company and for the female workers in the supply chain such as local artisans, designers, and tailors.
IFC anticipates that the Project will promote market integration by: i) improving standards across the value chain; ii) increasing access to market for local suppliers; iii) promoting development of retail infrastructure by creating demand for lease space and; iv) increasing formal retail penetration in Tier II/III cities. The expansion of Khaadi stores into Tier II and III cities of Pakistan will increase access to goods at attractive price-points and quality products otherwise not available outside large cities in the country.

Khaadi Corporation (SMC-Private) Limited (Khaadi or the Company) is a leading retailer of Pakistan with largest market share in formal apparel retail market. Khaadi started operations in 1998 with one store and has expanded its retail network to 62 stores in over 25 cities in Pakistan and 14 international stores in Qatar (1), UAE (6), Bahrain (1) and United Kingdom (6), to mainly cater to the South Asian communities in these countries. ? The Company is undertaking an expansion plan to (i) help grow its operations as it recovers from disruptions related to COVID-19 through expansion of footprint/retail space by adding stores in strategic locations in tier II and III cities across Pakistan, optimization of existing retail space, (ii) acceleration of global online sales, and (iii) expansion of the international store network (the Project) and has invited IFC to consider supporting its investment program.
